what: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
title: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
text: function generates adjusted boxplot, robust graphical method visualizing skewed data distributions. provides accurate representation data's spread skewness compared traditional boxplots, especially presence outliers heavy-tailed distributions.

title: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
code: adjboxplot(   .data,   .plot = TRUE,   xlabels.angle = 90,   xlabels.vjust = 1,   xlabels.hjust = 1,   box.width = 0.5,   notch = FALSE,   notchwidth = 0.5,   staplewidth = 0.5 )

title: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
text: .data numeric data frame tibble containing variables plotted. .plot logical value indicating whether plot adjusted boxplot (default TRUE). xlabels.angle numeric value specifying angle (degrees) x-axis labels (default 90). xlabels.vjust numeric value specifying vertical justification x-axis labels (default 1). value 0 means labels aligned bottom viewport, 0.5 means vertically centered, 1 means aligned top viewport. xlabels.hjust numeric value specifying horizontal justification x-axis labels (default 1). value 0 means labels aligned left viewport, 0.5 means horizontally centered, 1 means aligned right viewport. box.width numeric value specifying width boxplot (default 0.5). notch logical value indicating whether display notched boxplot (default FALSE). notchwidth numeric value specifying width notch relative body boxplot (default 0.5). staplewidth numeric value specifying width staples ends whiskers.

title: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
text: .plot = TRUE, returns ggplot2 object containing adjusted boxplot. .plot = FALSE, returns data frame adjusted boxplot statistics.

title: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
text: adjusted boxplot based methodology described : G. Brys, M. Hubert, . Struyf, "Robust Measure Skewness," Journal Computational Graphical Statistics, 13 (2004) M. Hubert E. Vandervieren, "adjusted boxplot skewed distributions," Computational Statistics & Data Analysis, 52 (2008)

title: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
text: Christian L. Goueguel

title: Adjusted Boxplot for Skewed Distributions — adjboxplot
code: # Generate some skewed data set.seed(123) data <- data.frame(   normal = rnorm(100),   skewed = rexp(100, rate = 0.5),   heavy_tailed = rt(100, df = 3) )  # Plot the adjusted boxplot adjboxplot(data) #> The default of 'doScale' is FALSE now for stability; #>   set options(mc_doScale_quiet=TRUE) to suppress this (once per session) message   # Retrieve the adjusted boxplot statistics stats <- adjboxplot(data, .plot = FALSE)

title: Classical or Robust Z-Score — zscore
text: Z-scores useful comparing data points different distributions dimensionless standardized. positive z-score indicates data point mean (median robust approach), negative z-score indicates data point mean (median). One common rule detect outliers using z-scores "three-sigma rule", data points absolute z-score greater 3 (|z| > 3) can considered potential outliers, fall outside range covers 99.7% data points normal distribution. (Note cutoff |z| > 2.5 also often used). Rousseeuw, P. J., & Croux, C. (1993). Alternatives median absolute deviation. Journal American Statistical Association, 88(424), 1273-1283. Rousseeuw, P. J., & Hubert, M. (2011). Robust statistics outlier detection. Wiley Interdisciplinary Reviews: Data Mining Knowledge Discovery, 1(1), 73-79.
